contentList.content: Practical Caster Gloves
Finely crafted gloves meant to accommadate all of the most outlandish flourishes and finger tricks of spell casting.
Sacred Ring
A small engraving on the ring reads: "Sometimes that what others see as sacred is really just something as scared as you are."
Sculptor's Gloves
Gloves for when you want to keep your hands clean while you're getting your hands dirty.
Ring of Unreasonable Force
Though it appears to be a perfectly normal ring by all accounts, somehow its look while wearing it seems... excessive.
Unreasonable Force
Whenever you deal Force damage to a creature, you can push the creature up to [1] away from you.
Cryothermic Clutches
In these gloves you feel like you could pick up a very hot ring from out of the fire and still remark "It's quite cool".
Hat of Frostfire Acuity
It is said some wizard hats grant the power to keep your head cool - both literally and figuratively.
Practical Caster's Guide to Glove Making
A short guide illustrating how different spell casting gloves can be carefully stitched together and still have all their effects used to the fullest.
'A Song of Ice and Fire' Review
A scathing review for some story you've never heard of. It evidently was unfinished, but told the tale of the forces of Cold and Heat joining together.
Portent Robe
This robe is a difficult look to pull off unless you're Sherlock Holmes and you always work alone because no else can compete with your massive intellect.
Erudite Caster
Your <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Well-Read and Well-Fortified

At the beginning of the wearer's turn, the robe activates, granting them <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to their Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Well-Read and Well-Fortified: instead of dying, you have gained <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit point</LSTag> equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Potent Rope
More useful than any other rope you've ever seen! Still not when it comes to climbing things though...
Great Wyrm's Scale

The last part of the great wyrm Ansur that has not succombed to decay. It shines with a more chromatic glow than you would expect from just a Bronze dragon. You feel as if this scale could be used to transmute powerful draconic magic into new receptacles.
Gloves of Finesse
Wearing these gloves makes the motions of your hands feel fluid and deadly, letting you wield even the least elegant of weapons with surprising grace.
Gloves of Ultimate Skullduggery
With these gloves, you will fell your enemies quicker than they can ask "What the hells is 'Skullduggery' anyway?"
Secrets to Skullduggery
A worn out piece of parchment that simply reads "Stick 'em with the pointy end".
Second Strike Ring
You can discern a small inscription around the ring that reads "Those that want me already have me. Those that don't have me don't want me. What am I?"
Necklace of Universal Augmentation
The tourmaline in this necklace is almost uncomfortably cool, chilled by a cold all its own.
Universal Augmentation

When one of your <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant or Thunder damage, add your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Modifier</LSTag> to the damage dealt.
Arcane Striker's Gloves
Fizzling barbs of evocation magic crackle from the fingertips of these gloves.
Synergetic Strikes

When you make a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">melee weapon attack</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_CHARGE">Arcane Charge</LSTag>. When you make a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeSpellAttack">melee spell attack</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_SYNERGY">Arcane Synergy</LSTag>.
Gloves of the Arcane Warrior
Engraved on the gauntlets are a list of three virtues: "Unity, Duty, Destiny". However, they've since been scratched over to instead read "Synergy, Charge, Acuity".
Ring of Arcane Ferocity
Arcane Ferocity
Bonuses you receive to your spell <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag> also get added to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Weapon Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_GISH_ARCANE_ACUITY">Arcane Acuity</LSTag> also applies its bonus to weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag>.
